definition: to exile/to banish/to deport/to float (logs) downstream
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

sentences.english: However, the delegation were accused of spying and sent in exile to a desert.
sentences.chinese: 外交团被指间谍，被流放到沙漠。

sentences.english: The exiles were forbidden to return at the peril of their lives.
sentences.chinese: 流放犯已被禁止返回，违者处死。

sentences.english: Our problem is, as exiles, we are…
sentences.chinese: 我们的问题是，作为流放者，我们。

sentences.english: The old king returned to power after ten years' banishment.
sentences.chinese: 这位年老的国王在流放了十年以后又重掌政权。

sentences.english: Henry II was so angry that he drove Becket in to exile.
sentences.chinese: 亨利二世非常愤怒，就流放了贝克特。

sentences.english: He is the Prince of Ayodhya and is banished to a forest by his stepmother.
sentences.chinese: 他是阿约迪亚的王子，被他的继母流放到森林。

sentences.english: Law was initially a type of penalty, i.
He was condemned to life-long exile.
He was speaking from Luxemburg but lives in exile in France.
sentences.chinese: 他在卢森堡发表讲话，却被流放到法国。

sentences.english: Exile was for him a living death.
sentences.chinese: 他遭流放是进了活地狱。

sentences.english: The timelimit also changed from limited term to indefinite time.
sentences.chinese: 流放期限也从有期变为终生服役等。

sentences.english: The old chancellor who had offended against the emperor was relegated to the distant boundaries of the country.
sentences.chinese: 触犯了皇帝的老宰相被流放到遥远的边疆。

sentences.english: She was exiled from her country.
Men know that they are sexual exiles.
sentences.chinese: 男人知道他们是性的流放者。

sentences.english: Jack was exiled for political reasons.
sentences.chinese: 杰克因政治原因遭到流放。

sentences.english: Like a king in exile, uncrowned in the underworld.
sentences.chinese: 像流放中的君王，被废黜到地狱。

definition: to send away to serve a penal sentence
to banish (to an army post, as a punishment)
to banish from the court/to relegate
to demote an official/a demoted official
an execution/to put sb to death
to dismiss from office/to resign from office
to imprison/to place under house arrest
to sack/to remove from a position/to depose
to dismiss from office/to ban/to reject
